subject: Economics
title: Remote Work Revolution: Geography Unshackled
description: A 60-second lesson on Remote Work Revolution: Geography Unshackled.

hook.text: Before COVID, 5% of work was remote. In 2023, 30% of work is hybrid or remote.

buildup.text: Remote work decouples jobs from geography. A programmer in Boise competes with one in Bangalore.

discovery.text: Studies show remote workers are equally or more productive. Commuting wastes 200+ hours per year.

twist.text: But remote work threatens urban economies.

climax.text: Remote work redistributes economic activity from expensive cities to everywhere else.

punchline.text: COVID didn't invent remote work. It removed the last excuse not to try it.

quiz.question: How does remote work affect geographic inequality?
options: It redistributes economic activity from expensive urban centers to smaller cities and rural areas worldwide
